resources.string: Novel reading right on your phone!

Columns of novels in landscape mode
Swap between a grid or list for displaying novels
Toast when the unread badge is clicked to explain what it is for
That\'s it for an intro, Read well!
Default on, off will not save your progress
Default is off, which will not save your settings
This feature have not been reintroduced yet due to time constraints :(
Allows the reader to mark a read chapter as reading when its opened up.
Are you sure about removing this category?
All string based extensions are rendered as html
Swipe left and right to move between chapters
There are no extensions, Refresh this page or check your repositories
You don\'t have any novels, Go to “Browse” and add some
No updates, Lets check for some\n(Refresh or press below)
No downloads pending, Go download some chapters
You have no repositories, This app is useless without them
Verify if the extension content matches the checksum from the index
Failed to toggle enabled state of repository
Are you sure about removing this repository?
If enabled, will require the user to do the back action 2x to leave the app
The chapter reader will keep the screen on while open
Failed to load extension from db %d
Invert the chapter swipe when horizontally paging
Create a notification displaying progress when an extension is being downloaded/installed.
Cannot load novel content while offline
You have read all the chapters.
Press apply to change the UI
URL to load was null, Sorry!
Displays a page between chapters telling you which chapter you are on, and what is the next one
Fullscreen mode hides system bars when reading
Match the fullscreen state to the reader focus mode
Disable a repository if it fails to update, mostly for testing.
This is the icon of Monogatari
Kill all cyclic workers to reset them.
How often does the novel updater run
Only update novels that are ongoing
If toggled on, Allows novels to update while the device is on a metered connection
If toggled on, Allows novels to update while the device has a low battery level
If toggled on, Allows novels to update while the device is running out of storage space
If toggled on, Novels will only update when the device is idle
Swaps between two stypes of notifications. Check them out :D
If toggled on, You will have no idea what novels are being updated
Instead of showing you which how many chapters are in each novel, simply says \“Completed Update\”
If toggled on, Allows Repositories to update while the device is on a metered connection
If toggled on, Allows Repositories to update while the device has a low battery level
If toggled on, allows Repositories to update while the device is running out of storage space
How text is aligned in the reader
How chapters are marked as read
When clicking the resume button in the novel info view, will ignore reading status to open unread first

Clear all cookies that Monogatari has for websites
Change the theme that the application uses
Enable custom colors that override the selected preset theme.
Removes any unbookmarked novels & info from Monogatari
What list of novels should be displayed when the user opens up the extension to browse
Expose an option to truly remove a chapter from Monogatari.\nUseful when a chapter is bugging
Failed to create logfile, No logs will be stored
Print chapter names to log during restore.\nUseful for debugging, not useful otherwise.\nMust be set before restoring
Backup only modified chapters, this saves on memory and file size
No backup has been selected to export
URI not provided to export backup to
Enabling logs to a file, but may cause slow downs.\nRequires a restart
Download chapters that have been recently added to Updates
Please input an integer between a range of %1$d and %2$d (inclusive)
Please input an float between a range of %1$d and %2$d (inclusive)
Automatically bookmark novels that are scanned via QR code.
Error checking if extension has search: %s
Null content resolver when trying to write backup
How can the export file be missing
Instead of a single tap, require a double tap to toggle the focus in the reader.
Double tap to toggle system UI
By double tapping, one can toggle the system UI in the reader.\nDoes not work with double tap to toggle focus.
Allows backups to occur on low storage, also effects cycle worker
Allows backups to occur on low battery, also effects cycle worker
Forces backups to occur when device is idle, also effects cycle worker
Sometimes, Repo sync does not load properly. This will force the repo to update.
Enable error reporting to Monogatari\nIf enabled, Monogatari will collect crash logs containing device information and the app state during a crash.
Enable error reporting to Monogatari\nRequires App Restart
For legal purposes, please carefully read all of the following license to understand your rights.
Monogatari uses notifications for many ongoing tasks such as updates and backups.
Good news, Monogatari needs no permissions!
"Monogatari is a Libre FOSS Android application to read Novels.\nOnly with Monogatari can you have all your novel reading features in one place."
You can continue without this permission and enable it later from Settings.
How often should backups be automatically made
There are no categories, add one!
Force tables to have a scroll bar for overflows. Enabling this can break accessibility functionality.
Determines the delay between each request to a site. Helping prevent site bans.
If you have issues with accidently selecting text, this can help you.
Select date to clear updates before
Select a date to clear before
What chapter to delete when a chapter is read (includes previous chapters).
Identification to send to sites when making requests. Changes applied after restart.
Explicitly identify the program as Monogatari. Disabled by default due to possible site blocks.
Start building a structured extension specification.
Generation status: Stub generated Lua preview
Generation status: Stub generated no output
Storage status: Stub saved locally (%1$d spec)
Please look at something at least 5–10 meters away for 20 seconds to avoid eye damage.
Track users reading time to ensure the user maintains their eye health by requiring the user to look at something 5-10 meters away for 20 seconds every 20 minutes.
Failed to save extension builder data
Fix validation errors before generating Lua
Extension with this ID already exists. Replacing existing install.
This extension returned 0 items (parsing may not be implemented yet).
Listing returned 0 items. The website loaded successfully, but no parsing logic is implemented yet.
Parsing is optional. If disabled, generated Lua remains template mode.
Advanced mode lets you inject one Lua snippet used by listing/search/novel/passage hooks.
• You will copy CSS selectors from your browser’s Inspect tool.
• We use these selectors to find titles, links, and images in the page HTML.
• Tip: Prefer stable class selectors like .media-item instead of long selectors with > and :nth-child.
• After filling fields, press ‘Test Parsing’ to verify.
• Open the website in your desktop browser.
• Right click the highlighted HTML element → Copy → Copy selector.
• Simplify it if needed (remove #app > div > ... and :nth-child).
• Paste into the field below and run Test Parsing.

Selects ONE repeated ‘book card’ element (title + cover + link). In Inspect: choose the outer container that repeats for every book. Example: .media.mangas-list or .book-item. Avoid overly long selectors with :nth-child.
Title selector inside the book card
Finds the title element inside each book card. Example: .media-body h2 or .title. Usually uses TEXT (not an attribute).
Where to read the title from
TEXT: visible text (recommended). ATTRIBUTE: use an attribute like title or data-title (rare).
Link selector inside the book card
Selects the <a> element that links to the novel detail page. Example: a or .media-body > a.
Cover image selector inside the book card
Selects the inside the card. Example: img or .manga-block img.
Usually src. If the site uses lazy-loading, try data-src.
If Test Parsing shows empty images, switch between src and data-src.
Inspect the novel page heading. Example: h1 or .entry-title.
Inspect the novel cover image. Example: .cover img.
Inspect the summary block. Example: .summary or .description.
Select the repeated chapter row container. Example: .chapter-row.
Selector inside each chapter row for title text. Example: a or .chapter-title.
Selector inside each chapter row for the chapter link (<a>).
The attribute that contains the chapter URL. Usually "href".
Selectors to remove before output. Example: script, .ads, .banner.
This selector looks too specific (contains :nth-child). Consider using a class selector like .book-item.
This selector looks too specific (long > chain). Try a shorter selector.
Attribute names should be plain text like href or src (no quotes/spaces).
Please fill the required fields for this section.
Fetched HTML: success • URL=%1$s • HTTP=%2$d • size=%3$d chars
No book cards matched. Check Item selector.
Try selecting the outer repeating container.
Link matches in first card: %1$d • sample href: %2$s
Image matches in first card: %1$d • sample image attr: %2$s
Title selector found 0 elements inside card. Inspect the title node and copy its selector.
URL selector found 0 links. Make sure you select the <a> element.
Image selector found 0 images. Try img or .cover img.
Enable parsing and select Basic mode to run this test.
Enter a listing URL, novel URL, or chapter URL first.
Internal error: network executed on UI thread (fixed).
